newsitem.title: USA: Connecticut to seek RJR Reynolds proxy vote.
newsitem.headline: Connecticut to seek RJR Reynolds proxy vote.

text.p: Connecticut State Treasurer Christopher Burnham said on Monday that he will ask the state's money managers to oppose the "Joe Camel" advertising campaign by RJ Reynolds Tobacco Co.

In a news release, Burnham said he believes the campaign targets young people and stated that he would ask for a proxy vote at the annual RJR shareholders meeting April 16 in Winston-Salem, North Carolina.
The state of Connecticut owns more than $11 million in RJR stock through its pension funds, the release said.
The release said the advertising campaign, which features a cartoon camel, is "effectively creating new generations of underage smokers."
Earlier Monday the Federal Trade Commission said a renewed investigation into the company's "Joe Camel" campaign could open a broader investigation of tobacco advertising.
